title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.56 - Executive Order No. 56: Temporary Suspension and Modification of Regulatory Provisions of the State Office for the Aging During the State Disaster Emergency
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8.56 - Executive Order No. 56: Temporary Suspension and Modification of Regulatory Provisions of the State Office for the Aging During the State Disaster Emergency

State Regulations
WHEREAS, on October 26, 2012 I issued Executive Order

Number 47 declaring a disaster emergency in all 62 counties in the State of New

York; NOW, THEREFORE, I, ANDREW M. CUOMO, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by Section 29-a of Article
2-B of the Executive Law to temporarily suspend or modify specific provisions
of any statute, local law, ordinance, orders, rules or regulations, or parts
thereof, of any agency during a State disaster emergency, if compliance with
such provisions would prevent, hinder or delay action necessary to cope with
the disaster, hereby temporarily suspend and modify the following
regulations: Subdivision (h) of Section
6654.16
of Title 9 of the New York

Codes, Rules and Regulations, to the extent that the 10-day and 5-day periods
for assessments under the Expanded In-Home Services for the Elderly Program
("EISEP") are modified to 45 working days, when such periods otherwise would
conclude during the period from the date when the disaster emergency was
declared pursuant to Executive Order Number 47, issued October 26, 2012, until
further notice; Subdivision (n) of Section
6654.16
of Title 9 of the New York

Codes, Rules and Regulations, to the extent that the 12-month period during
which care plans may be in effect is modified to 15 months, when such care
plans otherwise would expire during the period from the date when the disaster
emergency was declared pursuant to Executive Order Number 47, issued October
26, 2012, until further notice; and

Subdivision (x) of Section
6654.16
of Title 9 of the New York

Codes, Rules and Regulations, to the extent that the 12-month period for
reassessments for EISEP is modified to 15 months, and the 5-day period for
reassessments due to changes in circumstances is modified to 45 working days, when such periods otherwise would conclude during the period from the date when
the disaster emergency was declared pursuant to Executive Order Number 47, issued October 26, 2012, until further notice. Signed: Andrew M. Cuomo

Dated: November 2, 2012

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
8.56

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
